description.english: Rumours about you have begun to spread around Barnsdale because you achieved 10% Reputation there.
You have announced yourself to the people of Barnsdale by achieving 20% Reputation there.
You have become familiar to the people of Barnsdale by achieving 30% Reputation there.
Your presence in Barnsdale is now tolerated because you achieved 40% Reputation there.
You are now liked by the people of Barnsdale because you achieved 50% Reputation there.
You have become a friend to the people of Barnsdale by achieving 60% Reputation there.
You are now idolised by the people of Barnsdale because you achieved 70% Reputation there.
You have become a folk hero to the people of Barnsdale by achieving 80% Reputation there.
You have become the beloved saviour of Barnsdale by achieving 90% Reputation there.
You have done everything in your power to help the people of Barnsdale by achieving 100% Reputation there.
The Sheriff will surely hear of your deeds now that you’ve liberated Barnsdale from his rule…
You’ve completed the game’s tutorial with Friar Tuck.
You’ve obtained the special trophy item from the region of Barnsdale.
Rumours about you have begun to spread around Peak District because you achieved 10% Reputation there.
You have announced yourself to the people of Peak District by achieving 20% Reputation there.
You have become familiar to the people of Peak District by achieving 30% Reputation there.
Your presence in Peak District is now tolerated because you achieved 40% Reputation there.
You are now liked by the people of Peak District because you achieved 50% Reputation there.
You have become a friend to the people of Peak District by achieving 60% Reputation there.
You are now idolised by the people of Peak District because you achieved 70% Reputation there.
You have become a folk hero to the people of Peak District by achieving 80% Reputation there
You have become the beloved saviour of Peak District by achieving 90% Reputation there.
You have done everything in your power to help the people of Peak District by achieving 100% Reputation there.
Now that the Sheriff no longer holds domain over Peak District, you have brazenly insulted his authority.
You’ve obtained the special trophy item from the region of Peak District.
Rumours about you have begun to spread around Sherwood Forest because you achieved 10% Reputation there.
You have announced yourself to the people of Sherwood Forest by achieving 20% Reputation there.
You have become familiar to the people of Sherwood Forest by achieving 30% Reputation there.
Your presence in Sherwood Forest is now tolerated because you achieved 40% Reputation there.
You are now liked by the people of Sherwood Forest because you achieved 50% Reputation there.
You have become a friend to the people of Sherwood Forest by achieving 60% Reputation there.
You are now idolised by the people of Sherwood Forest because you achieved 70% Reputation there.
You have become a folk hero to the people of Sherwood Forest by achieving 80% Reputation there.
You have become the beloved saviour of Sherwood Forest by achieving 90% Reputation there.
You have done everything in your power to help the people of Sherwood Forest by achieving 100% Reputation there.
Driving the Sheriff and his cronies out of Sherwood Forest and into the confines of Nottingham has made you his archnemesis.
You’ve obtained the special trophy item from the region of Sherwood Forest..
Rumours about you have begun to spread around the Midlands because you achieved 10% Reputation there.
You have announced yourself to the people of the Midlands by achieving 20% Reputation there.
You have become familiar to the people of the Midlands by achieving 30% Reputation there.
Your presence in the Midlands is now tolerated because you achieved 40% Reputation there.
You are now liked by the people of the Midlands because you achieved 50% Reputation there.
You have become a friend to the people of the Midlands by achieving 60% Reputation there.
You are now idolised by the people of the Midlands because you achieved 70% Reputation there.
You have become a folk hero to the people of the Midlands by achieving 80% Reputation there.
You have become the beloved saviour of the Midlands by achieving 90% Reputation there.
You have done everything in your power to help the people in the Midlands by achieving 100% Reputation there.
The Sheriff falls defeated and his tyranny draws to an end. You have completed the main story of Robin Hood: Sherwood Builders.
You’ve obtained the special trophy item from the region of Midlands.
Defeat 50 enemies.
Kill 30 enemies using the ‘Dynamic’ combat mode setting.
Defeat 25 enemies with a backstab.
Win the Grand Archery Tournament in Wakefield.
Gain the maximum score in the Grand Archery Tournament in Wakefield.
Complete your first Royal Convoy Event.
Complete your first Beheading Event.
Complete your first Hanging Event.
You’ve completed all unique side quests in the Barnsdale region.
You’ve completed all unique side quests in the Peak District region.
You’ve completed all unique side quests in the Sherwood Forest region.
You’ve completed all unique side quests in the Midlands region.
Hunt down your first doe.
Cut down your first tree.

displayName.english: A Page Right Out of History

description.english: Mine your first stone.
Collect your first herb.
Kill 30 enemies using the ‘Precise’ combat mode setting.
Shoot down 15 birds.
Construct every building in Robin’s Village at maximum level, including a certain sanitary facility.
Construct your first ‘Community’ category building.
Construct your first ‘Workshop’ category building.
Construct your first ‘Production’ category building.
Equip Robin’s Village with some very basic sanitation.
Construct all the buildings in the ‘Community’ category.
Construct all the buildings in the ‘Production’ category.
Construct all the buildings in the ‘Workshop’ category.
Solve your first puzzle.
Solve 25 puzzles.
Complete 1 minigame
Complete 25 minigames
Hopefully, Olivier will learn a lesson about gambling after his ordeal.
I can’t believe it’s over. Are better times finally ahead of us?
Lokke Greytooth fancied himself a fierce Northman. Didn’t live up to the expectation.
I’ve got no idea how we’ll repay the Elder for his guidance. If we ever meet him again…
We wouldn’t have got far without Friar Tuck’s merry demeanour.
Pity how things turned out for Alan. May his broken heart have better luck next time.
It may have been even more important to stop this man than the Sheriff himself.
The Coterel brothers are no more and the land will be better off for it.
A gift from the sentenced. Rumoured to bring good luck…
A gift from those grateful for their new home.
Little John sure knows how to throw a mean jab.
May nothing ever keep us apart, love.
It’s a wily fox that gets into every henhouse.
We’ll remember you fondly, Eustace. Though you could have been better to your dog.
A gift from Bennett the farmer. I wonder what it’s about?
A tax collector had this. Could it be real…?
Hopefully, Royse will get to have a long break from her worries.
Straight from the de Greys’ hidden larder.
Odo is probably one of the most puzzling people I’ve met in my life.
Milton Hawke has fallen and I can’t think of a better way to commemorate the event. Good thing it isn’t a real one, though.
A proper memento from a proper huntsman such as Graham Lindone.
